page.title: 14SCHOOLS IN RUDDINGTON
page.content: In the 17th.Century {James Peacock} said he would pay for a teacher and a schoolroom.This was the start of { {Ruddington Endowed Boys School.}In 1875 a new building was built in memory of {Sir Charles Paget}and his wife. The church school was founded in 1852 by {Sir Thomas Parkyn }and was in the building opposite the church. A lot of children attended these schools but some were very poor and could not afford the penny per day and they were part-timers as they worked on the farms or in the Knitting Shops. When free schooling started the same buildings were used until the {James {Peacock Infant School}was built in 1969 and then in 1972 the{Juniors moved to our present building on {Ashworth Avenue.}It has open plan classrooms with carpet areas and a large hall and playing field.
